attributes.action: use his position to ensure that when Peter Jackson remakes the Dambusters he keeps the famous Eric Coates' March as the title music.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
We've all had enough of some of the boring petitions on this site - let's use it properly this time to ensure that a famous piece of British history is given the recognition it deserves!

Personally, the ONLY Dambusters film for me will be the 1954 version starring Sir Michael Redgrave and Richard Todd.

However, some 53 years later it will be good to see what Peter Jackson can make of the story of one of Britain's most ingenious wartime raids.

Change is good, but one thing should never change: The fact that the ONLY music to be associated with that story is the Eric Coates "The Dambusters March"  (Altogether now: Da da da da da-da-da daaa) and therefore ask that Gordon Brown show us his fun side by ensuring that the Minister for Culture, James Purnell, does his best to ensure that the title music on the remake remains as The Dambusters March!

(There's also the issue of the dog's name - after all, it is factual, but if we can have the music, we'll forget about that bit...!)

reasons: Intended to be humorous, or has no point about government policy
